posts.name: Lunar Robotics 9075
posts.cooked: Hello everyone, I am our small team’s only programmer, and I am very confused. This is our third year doing FRC , and my first with programming anything this serious. Our coach wants me to fill the shoes of the programmer before me and continue using the MK4i swerve drive module, but the code we used doesn’t work anymore, even after I tried updating it. I’ve read documentation but it hasn’t helped me much, and I am now calling out for help. I am hoping that someone out there could reach out to me and walk me through on how to code with swerve. Videos I’ve looked out seem out of date, and I am big on asking questions as I learn. I feel guilty for not knowing this stuff, but I really feel the need to learn. If someone out there would be willing to get in a zoom meeting or any call of the sorts, that would be extremely greatly appreciated. I hope everyone has a great year and places well in the competitions.

posts.name: Mitchell
posts.cooked: First off, its not a shame to not know something. It is a shame for refusing/not trying to learn something. Depending on what motors your using you might either want to checkout the CTRE swerve Generator or the YAGSL library. Both of these are designed for ease of use, and previous experience isn’t needed. Best of luck to you and your team.

posts.name: Skye Leake
posts.cooked: Mod note: thread title updated to more fully represent content of post

posts.name: Konnor/RetroBuzz | 5517AM
posts.cooked: If you decide to use YAGSL join the discord it is very active. YAGSL is only recommended if you don’t have a full ctre swerve setup.

If you are new to programming, you should try using YAGSL , a pretty easy to use swerve library. There are tutorials for setting up, with and with a robot, programming, autos, and even tuning. Not only that, it’s all up to date and easy to follow along. I highly recommend it if it’s your first year programming swerve. It’s also my first year using YAGSL and I have to say it’s pretty easy to use, plus the discord and documentation is helpful. I was able to get swerve programmed in less than a day. Here are some links to start out, you can find more tutorials searching up YAGSL tutorials on YouTube.

Brought to you by Yet Another Generic Swerve Library (YAGSL)

link_counts.title: Welcome to Yet Another Swerve Document | YAGSL

posts.name: Lunar Robotics 9075
posts.cooked: the drivetrain we have now uses SparkMaxes, would this mean that I shouldn’t use YAGSL , or should I ask that we get different motor controllers? Before this, our team used the 0 to Autonomous’s code in their sixth video, swerve drive auto, which worked fine after some changes at that time.

posts.name: Konnor/RetroBuzz | 5517AM
posts.cooked:
Use YAGSL . Heres the discord link you should get help pretty fast. I’m at work so I probably won’t be the one responding. Start by watching the tutorial videos then once you hit a snag feel free to ask any questions.

Check out the YAGSL community on Discord - hang out with 331 other members and enjoy free voice and text chat.

YAGSL is compatible with SparkMaxes. If you check the docs or the configuration tutorial, you can see that all you have to do to configure your robot for swerve drive is to select what modules you hav, your motor types, and module location. YAGSL does the rest of the hard work for you.
